result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
***Cash previously posted*****

New amended bond to include conditions of Maintain absolute sobriety Maintain absolute sobriety, Not to possess or consume intoxicants, No taverns or to be in the tavern portion of any restaurant premises. Curfew of 8:00 pm to 6:00 am seven days a week with the exception of employment.

1:59 PM Defendant Nathan D. Mann appeared by video, in custody Vilas County Jail .  Attorney Courtney Christine Jolin appeared by video for Nathan D. Mann.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. Bond amended with conditions of Maintain absolute sobriety, Not to possess or consume intoxicants, No taverns or to be in the tavern portion of any restaurant premises. Maintain absolute sobriety Clerk to forward competency to health services.
Order on Competency

3:24 PM Defendant Nathan D. Mann in court, in custody.  Attorney Courtney Christine Jolin in court for Nathan D. Mann.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. Competency evaluation report filed with the court.  All parties have received report. Defendant not competent but likely to become competent in the future.  State is waiving opportunity to present evidence.  Proceedings suspended by the court .  Defendant's custody turned over to DHS.  Court to complete order.  Motion to modify bond.  State/Defense make bond arguments. Court denies motion to modify bond.
Review hearing scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Review hearing on November 9, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

3:11 PM Defendant Nathan D. Mann in court, in custody.  Attorney Courtney Christine Jolin in court for Nathan D. Mann.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorneys agree that no competency evaluation has been completed to date. Attorney Jolin notes he has had appointments scheduled but he was not able to make contact via phone or in person.  Bond continued.
Status hearing scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Competency hearing on July 11, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant appears in court with Attorney Jolin. DA Hayes appears in court for the State of Wisconsin.   Waiver of preliminary hearing.  Rights given.  Court finds defendant is making a knowing and voluntary waiver of right to preliminary examination.  Court finds probable cause.  Bound over for arraignment on an information.  State files information in court and provides copies to defense.  Defense waives reading of information.  Not guilty plea entered by court.  Bond continued. Court sets pre - trial date for March 1st at 10:00 am. bond continued.

Defendant appears in court with Attorney Jolin. ADA Niemi appears by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant received complaint. Attorney Jolin waives reading and time limits for preliminary hearing. Court accepts waivers and sets preliminary hearing for January 19th at 9:30 am.
